page.title: 15DUTCH ELM DISEASE IN PLAISH
page.content: Dutch Elm disease is a fungus carried by bark beetles - Scolytidae. The elm tree's habit of sending up suckers from its roots has contributed to the spread of Dutch Elm disease,a virulent strain,which was introduced into this country in 1967 and spread rapdily. This has devastated the beautiful elms in Plaish and changed the landscape of the hamlet. In a wood, several trees may be connected underground - all of them starting out as suckers from one tree. When any one of the trees is infected the disease travels throughout the root system killing one tree after the other.
